Title: NAWIS expresses condolences following tragic road accident involving Kano athletes
Summary: Association of Nigerian Women in Sports expresses condolences following tragic road accident involving Kano athletes . NAWIS expresses its deepest condolences to the Government of Kano State, the National Sports Commission and the families of the athletes and officials .

Title: Reps mourn Kano athletes killed in crash
Summary: Reps mourn Kano State contingent to the National Sports Festival ‘Gateway Games 2025,” which was held in Abeokuta, Ogun State, following the accident that claimed the lives of over 20 sportsmen at the Dakatsalle Bridge .

Title: Where growth meets security: A conversation with Favour Adeniyi, Microsoft designer building trust in enterprise tech
Summary: Favour Adeniyi is a Nigerian product designer at Microsoft . She works at the intersection of growth, security, and user trust in enterprise technology . At just 24, she has contributed to the design of secure acquisition experiences for Microsoft Azure .

Title: Celestine Achi launches free AI tools to empower African media professionals
Summary: Renowned AI educator and public relations (PR) technology expert, Dr. Celestine Achi, launches free AI tools to empower African media professionals . The tools are AI Readiness Assessment Tool and AI Maturity Assessment Tool .

Title: Groups call for stronger protection of parrots in Nigeria
Summary: Conservationists advocate stronger protection of parrots in Nigeria . The groups Wild Africa and World Parrot Trust Parrots said the parrots, especially the African grey parrot, are threatened by illegal trade .

Title: 2027: No automatic tickets for Ojogo, Jimoh Ibrahim – Ex-militant Ajube warns
Summary: A former militant and chieftain of the APC in Ondo State, Senior High Chief Bibopere Ajube, has declared that no automatic tickets will be allowed for sitting National Assembly members from the Southern Senatorial District in the 2027 general elections .

Title: Viral Video: Gov Eno’s daughter manipulated by false prophets – AKSG
Summary: Mrs Jane Eddidiong Ufot was under the manipulation of ‘false prophets’ to share the viral video . She called out her father, Governor Umo Eno, over perceived evil forces behind last year’s death of her mother, Pastor Mrs Patience Eno .

Title: 2027: Atiku, Amaechi, El-Rufai hungry for state resources – APC
Summary: Atiku Abubakar, Rotimi Amaechi, Nasir El-Rufai accused of weaponizing poverty . The ruling All Progressives Congress APC lashed out at the trio of former Vice President Atiku and former Governor of Kaduna State . APC accuses them of trying to return to feeding off on the

Title: One killed as rival cultists clash during masquerade procession in Osun
Summary: A suspected cultist, identified as Kazeem, was reportedly killed on Sunday evening following a clash between rival cult groups escorting a masquerade in Osogbo, the Osun State capital .

Title: Nigeria spends over $1.5bn annually on milk imports, produces only 700,000 metric tonnes – Minister
Summary: Nigeria spends over $1.5 billion annually on dairy imports due to a significant gap between local production and demand . Minister of Livestock Development, Idi Maiha, said the country produces only 700,000 metric tonnes annually .

Title: Enugu orders disco to refund 20,000 customers for over-billing
Summary: The order followed a thorough investigation into the company’s billing practices, which revealed a significant increase in estimated billing violations . MainPower has until the July 2025 billing cycle to complete the refunds . Failure to comply with the order will attract a fine of N500,000 for each day of non-compliance, as stipulated in the

Title: Peter Obi visits Niger flood victims, donates N20m
Summary: Labour Party presidential candidate Peter Obi donated N20 million to flood victims in Niger State . 153 people have been reported dead with over 100 others missing in the flash flood that ravaged the Mokwa communities last week . The ex-Anambra State Governor promised to personally visit the families of the victims .

Title: FRSC to probe  Kano athletes road crash
Summary: The Federal Road Safety Corps has launched an investigation into the tragic road crash that claimed the lives of 22 athletes from Kano State . The Zonal Commanding Officer in charge of Jigawa, Kaduna, and Katsina States, Assistant Corps Marshal Ahmed Umar, disclosed this on Monday during a condolence visit to the Kano

Title: Two Zamfara vigilantes die as NAF airstrikes kill 20 terrorists
Summary: The Nigerian Air Force said over 20 terrorists were eliminated and at least 21 motorcycles were destroyed during an air interdiction mission on May 31, 2025 . However, the service said the successful operation was marred by the accidental bombing of local vigilantes, leading to the death of two and causing injuries to another two vigilantes . The operation

Title: Police hunt suspected cultist for killing rival during masquerade festival
Summary: Residents of the Oke Ola Community in Osogbo have been thrown into palpable fear following the reported killing of a resident identified simply as Kazeem by a suspected cultist . Armed police operatives were observed in strategic positions, apparently to prevent further breakdown of law and order .
